intro: Campium gaboonense, commonly known as the Gaboon spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same plant.
